topics.name: Math Quiz
topics.description: Test your college level math skills!

questions.question: What is the derivative of f(x) = 3x^2 - 2x + 5 with respect to x?
If a triangle has angles measuring 30 degrees, 60 degrees, and x degrees, what is the value of x?
Solve the equation: 2x - 5 = 7.
What is the value of √(16/9) + 1/3?
If a circle has a radius of 5 units, what is its circumference?
Evaluate the integral: ∫(2x^2 + 3x - 1) dx.
What is the value of sin(60 degrees)?

topics.name: Physics
topics.description: Don't worry there's only a few questions for this quiz.

questions.question: A car is initially at rest and accelerates uniformly at a rate of 2 m/s² for 5 seconds. How far does the car travel during this time?
In an electric circuit, a 12V battery is connected to a resistor with a resistance of 4 ohms. What is the current passing through the resistor?
A gas is initially at a temperature of 300 K. If the gas absorbs 2000 J of heat and does 1000 J of work, what is the final temperature of the gas? (Assume the gas is ideal)
Who is known as the 'God of Thunder' in the Marvel Universe?
What is the real name of the mutant superhero with optic blasts known as Cyclops?
Which superhero wears a suit made of vibranium and is the king of Wakanda?
Who is the arch-nemesis of Spider-Man and often portrayed as a wealthy businessman with an affinity for the color green?
What is the name of Tony Stark's AI-powered assistant in the Iron Man suits?
Which superhero is also known as the 'First Avenger' and has a shield made of vibranium?
Who is the genius billionaire, philanthropist, and inventor who becomes the armored superhero Iron Man?
Which superhero is a lawyer by day and fights crime in Hell's Kitchen by night?
Who is known for his incredible regenerative healing factor and is often seen with adamantium claws?
Which character is the adoptive brother of Thor and the trickster god of Asgard?
